mdRecord.dcterms:title: Carrel 4-5, north wall
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Donohue, Liam Patrick [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Various religious graffiti, including some expressing hopeful belief, and others that are critical, including a doodle of the flying spaghetti monster, and a doodle of a Latin cross. Series of dates. List of dates, including one that reads 420/420/420 (reference to marijuana), and one with a note beside September 11th. [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]
↓ yeah, I'm in the library + this didn't give me any rest. thx but no | no he doesn't → you give rest to the restless | phallic ↑
